definition: good teacher and helpful friend (idiom); mentor

sentences.english: Finding a mentor has always been a very effective strategy for me.
sentences.chinese: 尋找良師益友一直是對我非常有效的策略。

sentences.english: Wide world, Faithful cooperation, Making helpful friends and Seeking mutual development.
sentences.chinese: 廣闊天地，真誠合作，廣交益友，共同發展。

sentences.english: They had many mentors, and they stood on the shoulders of giants.
sentences.chinese: 他們有許多良師益友，並且他們站在在巨人的肩膀上。

sentences.english: As is known to all, good friends add happiness and value to life.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，良朋益友使生活平添樂趣與價值。
球童是球員擊球的良師益友。

sentences.english: Having a mentor is the crux to the vocationing process.
sentences.chinese: 擁有一位良師益友是職業進程的關鍵。

sentences.english: A mentor will help guide you, and avoid obvious mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 一個良師益友將引導你避免明顯的錯誤。

definition: a friend capable of direct admonition
good teacher and helpful friend (idiom); mentor
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
friend from whom you can seek advice
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
